articles.author: DAVID SHARP, PATRICK WHITTLE, HOLLY RAMER and MICHELLE R. SMITH
articles.description: LEWISTON, Maine (AP) — The Army reservist who opened fire in a bowling alley and then at a bar in Lewiston, Maine, killing 18 people, was found dead Friday from a self-inflicted gunshot, ending an intensive two-day search that had the state on edge.
articles.title: Maine mass killing suspect has been found dead, ending search that put entire state on edge

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, JOSEF FEDERMAN and BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel knocked out internet and communications in the Gaza Strip in stepped-up bombardment Friday night, largely cutting off its 2.3 million people from contact with each other and the outside world and creating a near-blackout of information, as the military said it was “expanding” ground operations in the territory.
articles.title: Israel steps up air and ground attacks in Gaza and cuts off the territory's communications

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: The Israeli military says its ground forces will expand their activities in Gaza Friday night.
articles.title: Live updates | UN calls for ‘humanitarian truce’ in Gaza as Israel expands activity in the territory

articles.author: DIDI TANG, MATTHEW LEE and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping have agreed to meet on the sidelines of next month’s Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco, according to a U.S.
articles.title: Agreement reached for Biden-Xi talks, but details still being worked out, official tells AP

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE
articles.description: FALMOUTH, Maine (AP) — Maine's close-knit community of deaf and hard of hearing people is grieving in the wake of the Lewiston shootings that killed beloved members, many of whom were ardent advocates.
articles.title: Maine's close-knit deaf community is grieving in the wake of shootings that killed 4 beloved members

articles.author: MEGAN JANETSKY
articles.description: ACAPULCO, Mexico (AP) — Desperate families made missing posters Friday and joined online groups to look for loved ones out of touch since Hurricane Otis devastated the Mexican Pacific coast city of Acapulco.
articles.title: Families hunt for loved ones not heard from since Hurricane Otis pummeled Acapulco

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD
articles.description: ROME (AP) — Pope Francis has ordered the Vatican to reopen the case of a well-known priest-artist accused of sexually, psychologically and spiritually abusing adult women, and removed the statute of limitations that had previously prevented a church trial based on their claims.
articles.title: Pope orders Vatican to reopen case of priest accused of adult abuse but allowed to keep ministering

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: A bullet-riddled family photo tacked to a refrigerator in Kibbutz Kissufim in southern Israel following the Oct. 7 Hamas attack. Horrific scenes of the lifeless bodies of Palestinian children pulled from the rubble in the Gaza Strip following Israeli retaliatory airstrikes.
articles.title: AP PHOTOS: Scenes of sorrow and despair on both sides of Israel-Gaza border on week 3 of war

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump is set to testify Nov. 6 at his New York civil fraud trial, following his three eldest children to the witness stand in a case that threatens to disrupt their family's real estate empire, state lawyers said Friday.
articles.title: Donald Trump is set to testify Nov. 6 in civil fraud trial. Daughter Ivanka also will testify

articles.author: KEVIN McGILL and STEPHEN SMITH
articles.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — The heating element removed from Monique Plaisance's water heater in September was disintegrating, streaked with rust and covered in a dry crust. She blamed the corrosion on the water piped in from the area's longtime drinking water source: the Mississippi River.
articles.title: A salty problem for people near the mouth of the Mississippi is a wakeup call for New Orleans
